content.question: In which of the following chord progressions is the first chord resolved correctly?

choices.label: Two whole-note chords on a grand staff. The key signature has one sharp. The first chord is F-sharp 3, D4, A4, and C5. The second chord is B2, B3, G4, and D5.
Two whole-note chords on a grand staff. The key signature has one sharp. The first chord is F-sharp 3, D4, A4, and C5. The second chord is G3, B3, G4, and D5.
Two whole-note chords on a grand staff. The key signature has one sharp. The first chord is F-sharp 3, D4, A4, and C5. The second chord is D3, D4, G4, and B4.
Two whole-note chords on a grand staff. The key signature has one sharp. The first chord is F-sharp 3, D4, A4, and C5. The second chord is G3, D4, G4, and B4.

content.answer: Two whole-note chords on a grand staff. The key signature has one sharp. The first chord is F-sharp 3, D4, A4, and C5. The second chord is G3, D4, G4, and B4.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Use symbols and terms to describe and apply harmonic, melodic, and rhythmic procedures of 18th-century voice leading (up to 4 voices) in notated music.
